Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador is the favorite to win this matchup.
Veteran striker Enner Valencia is expected to lead Ecuador’s attack.
Forward Kevin Rodriguez’s return from injury means he will also be part of the lineup.
Key player for Ecuador is Bayer Leverkusen left-back Piero Hincapie.
Venezuelan football icon Salomon Rondon is likely to return to the starting lineup after scoring as a substitute in the last friendly match.
Ecuador has scored 19 goals in 15 matches over the past two years, while conceding 13.
Venezuela, ranked 54th, has scored 12 goals in 13 matches during the same period, while allowing in 8.
Ecuador posted a positive goal differential of +6, while Venezuela was also in positive territory at +4.
Statistically, the odds favor Ecuador, with the moneyline odds at +100 for an Ecuador win, +225 for a draw, and +330 for a Venezuela victory.
The over/under for total goals is set at 1.5, with the over at -210 and the under at +165.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stage is set for an exciting clash between these two South American rivals.
Ecuador and Venezuela are set to face off at Levi’s Stadium today at 23:00 pm GMT+1 in a highly anticipated group stage match in the Copa America 2024, where they are both part of Group B.
This marked the teams’ second meeting in the Copa America, with their previous encounter ending in a 2-2 draw.
